remarks: Version of ~ fmptco where ` ph ` needn't be distinct from ` x ` . (Contributed by NM, 27-Dec-2014.)
statement:
fmptcof.1 $e |- ( ph -> A. x e. A R e. B ) $.
fmptcof.2 $e |- ( ph -> F = ( x e. A |-> R ) ) $.
fmptcof.3 $e |- ( ph -> G = ( y e. B |-> S ) ) $.
fmptcof.4 $e |- ( y = R -> S = T ) $.
fmptcof $p |- ( ph -> ( G o. F ) = ( x e. A |-> T ) ) $.
$d A x $.
$d B x y $.
$d R y $.
$d S x $.
$d T y $.
